channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Under tree on the corner of 37 Blean Grove, 18th October
item.description:
Someone keeps dumping bags of rubbish on a weekly basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blean Grove, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish strewn along the street, 18th October
item.description:
We still don't get regular cleaning of this bit of street. The cleaners stop at the bottom of Trenholme Terrace road by the flats/carpark there, and don't come up to the Close. Rubbish has built up again, please can you send a cleaning team.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trenholme Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling & rubbish, 18th October
item.description:
I didn't want to put a photo of the turds here, but there are dogturds as well as litter in this walkway. There are no lights so it is hard to avoid stepping in this at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trenholme Terrace, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken parking street sign and water sign outside 47 Lanark Road W9 1DE, 18th October
item.description:
Sign has been knocked down and is lying in the gutter and the yellow watering is displaced

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Lanark Road, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pile of leaves/branches with rubbish in there too, 18th October
item.description:
This pile has not been cleared for months - maybe 4 or 5. There is now rubbish mixed in with the leaves and branches and it obstructs the pavement. Some of the branches have thorns and it is hard to walk past here in the dark without catching on them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trenholme Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Antisocial behaviour cars honking all Hours junction causing anti-social behavior and nuisance to surrounding residents. Street management investigation team required. I'm going to seek legal advice., 18th October
item.description:
Motor vehicles honking and causing anti-social behavior at junction. Neighbours having restless nights.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chapman Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Prince of Wales Passage, 18th October
item.description:
Someone (the owner of the adjacent flats?) has built a wall across the passage, forcing pedestrians to walk through a dirty and usually littered alley. This has been a right of way for the 25 years I’ve lived in the area, and it appears someone has taken this away without permission. Please can the wall be immediately removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince of Wales Passage, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Fly tipping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 140, Brockley Rise, Honor Oak, London

item.title: Bath house community hub having late night early hours raves, parties loud music causing disturbance to surrounding properties and restless nights., 18th October
item.description:
Councillors,mayor of Hackney support this anti-social behaviour late-night parties they love it they even go there for spa pampering sessions. They don't care how the community feels.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastway, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There was a large group of black males and females in the range of about 60 or 70 more people on the streets and on the public grass smoking drugs drinking alcohol cars pulling up causing obstruction barbecues. Residence could not sleep with this antisocial behavior alcohol drug taking and loud music this is a regular occurrence on this stretch of Road at this location. Residence feel unsafe to go out of a night with this large group of black males it's quite intimidating can someone from Hackney Council please address this anti-social behavior criminal activity.Response police attended location in regards to breach of the peace public orders officer confiscated large Jamaican man's Bluetooth speaker. Antisocial behaviour at this location on a daily basis late at night. Hackney Council doing nothing about it., 18th October
item.description:
Antisocial behaviour criminal activity and public order offences happening on a daily basis residents of fed up and feel unsafe and insecure with this large groups gathering. Alcohol drugs and loud music

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dislodged kerb stones., 18th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spencer Road, London

item.title: Big items of rubbish dumped next to private parking area including few big metal items and a black bin, 18th October
item.description:
This area has atarted to becime a hotspot of flytipping and qe had reported numerous times , rubbish were dumped at public area where children play ad dogs walk daily. Previous claim hasnt been dealt with and now more rubbish dumped right next to this private parking area,it is distressing, to face it day to day infront of our door steps. It is not good for our mental and physical health. Please deal with it and put a sign to say it is not a pit and penulties should be applied. Thank you in advance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Brantwood Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over Craig’s Court, 18th October
item.description:
Bags dumped outside bt exchange - reported yesterday - more added !? excrement outside fire exit of Silver Cross food bins and other waste outside old shades - please get rid of some bins - starting with street cleaner and move other bins into a commercial area - why us this corner of Whitehall despite being residential always so filthy full of crushed glass excrement and pub's waste !??? please close it at least once oer year for cleaning - how can it be acceptable that this is continuing to be so filthy next to homes and businesses serving drinks and food !???

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
